qas.question: Customarily where is the expected place in the lives of the people for the home of monks in Burma ?

answers.text: In a traditional village, the monastery is the centre of cultural life.

qas.question: What event is exceedingly relevant for young males that involves monks in Burma ?
What do girls of the village get in comparison the the young male event ?

answers.text: Girls have ear-piercing ceremonies (နားသ) at the same time.

qas.question: What is the biggest celebration held in local events in Burma ?

answers.text: the most important being the pagoda festival

qas.question: What do many villages have that protects them in times of imminent or impending danger ?

answers.text: Many villages have a guardian nat

context: <a0_0>In a traditional village, the monastery is the centre of cultural life.<a0_0/> Monks are venerated and supported by the lay people. <a1_0>A novitiation ceremony called shinbyu<a1_0/> is the most important coming of age events for a boy, during which he enters the monastery for a short time. All male children in Buddhist families are encouraged to be a novice (beginner for Buddhism) before the age of twenty and to be a monk after the age of twenty. <a2_0>Girls have ear-piercing ceremonies (နားသ) at the same time.<a2_0/> Burmese culture is most evident in villages where local festivals are held throughout the year, <a3_0>the most important being the pagoda festival<a3_0/>. <a4_0>Many villages have a guardian nat<a4_0/>, and superstition and taboos are commonplace.
